identificationModule.briefTitle: Recovery by Endovascular Salvage for Cerebral Ultra-acute Embolism (RESCUE)-Japan Registry 2
identificationModule.officialTitle: Recovery by Endovascular Salvage for Cerebral Ultra-acute Embolism (RESCUE)-Japan Registry 2

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of this study is to clarify treatment status and clinical results of acute cerebral ischemia after approval of clot retriever in Japan, and also to obtain a basis for comparative studies.

interventions.name: endovascular treatment
interventions.description: endovascular treatment for acute ischemic stroke patients with large vessel occlusion

primaryOutcomes.measure: modified Rankin Scale (mRS) of 0-2 at 90 days (+/- 10 days) after onset

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Death within 90 days (+/- 10 day) after the onset
modified Rankin Scale (mRS) of 0-1 at 90 days (+/- 10 days) after onset
All bleeding within 90 days (+/- 10 days) after onset
All intracranial hemorrhage within 90 days (+/- 10 days) after onset
Symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage within 90 days (+/- 10 days) after onset

otherOutcomes.measure: Symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage within 72 hours (+/- 8 hours) after onset
Reccurrence of stroke within 90 days (+/- 10 days) after onset

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients admitted from Oct. 1st 2014 to Sep. 30st 2016.
* Patients who were 20 years and older admitted within 24 hours after onset.
* The patients with large vessel occlusion (ICA, MCA, VA, BA, PCA).
* Patients who did not fulfill the criteria of RESCUE-Japan RCT.

Exclusion Criteria:

ï½¥Patients who are considered inappropriate to participate in the study are excluded.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Acute cerebral large vessel occlusion admitted within 24 hours after onset.

Endovascular Therapy in Ischemic Stroke With Acute Large-Vessel Occlusion: Recovery by Endovascular Salvage for Cerebral Ultra-Acute Embolism Japan Registry 2.
